distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 3.7, 3.6, 3.5, 3.4, and 3.3.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
OpenShift Container Platform by Red Hat is the company's cloud computing Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) solution designed for on-premise or private cloud deployments.

This advisory contains the RPM packages for this release. See the following advisory for the container images for this release:

https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2018:0476

All OpenShift Container Platform 3 users are advised to upgrade to these updated packages and images.

Security Fix(es):

* kubernetes: Volume security can be sidestepped with innocent emptyDir and subpath (CVE-2017-1002101)

* pod: Malicious containers can delete any file from the node (CVE-2017-1002102)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform security update

notes.text: It was found that volume security can be sidestepped with innocent emptyDir and subpath. This could give an attacker with access to a pod full control over the node host by gaining access to docker socket.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kubernetes: Volume security can be sidestepped with innocent emptyDir and subpath
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw allows a pod to mount any part of the host filesystem. The pod will run with the security contraints placed on the user but could read anything with o=rx mode and appropriate SELinux label.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: kubernetes: Volume security can be sidestepped with innocent emptyDir and subpath

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

cwe.name: Improper Link Resolution Before File Access ('Link Following')

notes.text: This vulnerability allows containers using a secret, configMap, projected, or downwardAPI volume to trigger deletion of arbitrary files and directories on the nodes where they are running. An attacker could use this flaw to delete arbitrary file or directories on node host.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kubernetes: Malicious containers can delete any file from the node
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: kubernetes: Malicious containers can delete any file from the node
